That's a great idea!

Yes, absolutely mention your lost silver necklace to the jeweler! It's possible that someone might turn it in to them, and they can keep an eye out for it. Jewelers often have a lost and found or a system in place to reunite customers with their lost items.

Even if the jeweler doesn't have a specific policy for lost items, it's worth asking them to keep an eye out for your necklace. They might have a network of other jewelers or industry connections that could help you recover your lost piece.

When you mention the necklace, provide as much detail as possible, such as:

* A description of the necklace, including the type of metal, pendant, and any distinctive features
* When and where you last wore it (in this case, the beach)
* Any identifying marks or engravings on the necklace

This will help the jeweler keep an eye out for your specific necklace and increase the chances of it being returned to you.

Keep your fingers crossed, and who knows, you might be reunited with your beloved necklace!

Remember to also ask the jeweler about their policies and procedures for handling lost items, in case someone does turn in your necklace.
